title: California Boat Captain Indicted in Fire That Killed 34
sub_head: Jerry Boylan indicted on federal manslaughter charges for one of the deadliest maritime disasters in recent U.S. history
body:
LOS ANGELES—The captain of a scuba diving boat that caught fire and sank off the coast of California last year, killing 34 people who were trapped below deck, was indicted Tuesday on federal manslaughter charges for one of the deadliest maritime disasters in recent U.S. history.
Jerry Boylan, 67 years old, was charged with 34 counts of seaman’s manslaughter for “misconduct, negligence and inattention” by failing to train his crew, conduct fire drills and have a roving night watchman on the Conception when fire broke out Sept....
